modules.description: Handles TLS-encrypted HTTP connections by establishing secure socket handlers, processing requests with custom logic, and managing errors during communication. Operates on Unix socket addresses and TLS-specific socket types, integrating with HTTP request and response structures. Used to build secure web servers that authenticate clients, encrypt data streams, and route requests based on TLS session details.

Handles secure socket connections using SSL, providing functions to establish and manage HTTPS server connections. Operates with socket descriptors and SSL-specific configurations to process HTTP requests and errors. Used to build secure web servers that authenticate clients and encrypt data transmission.

Handles TLS-encrypted network communication by establishing secure connections, sending HTTP requests, and managing connection state. Operates on socket and runtime types derived from Gluten and Httpun libraries. Used to create secure client connections, send HTTP/1.1 requests with custom headers, and upgrade to WebSocket protocols.

Provides functions to establish and manage secure SSL connections, send HTTP requests with custom handlers, and upgrade to other protocols. Operates on socket and runtime types specific to SSL-based network communication. Used to create secure client connections, handle HTTP responses, and transition to alternative protocols like WebSockets.

Manages secure HTTP communication through TLS and SSL, handling encrypted socket connections, request processing, and error management. Operates on Unix socket addresses and SSL contexts, supporting authentication, encryption, and routing based on session data. Provides functions to establish HTTPS servers, process HTTP messages over secure channels, and manage session-specific configurations. Examples include building servers that enforce client certificates, encrypt data in transit, and route requests based on TLS metadata.

Manages secure network communication through TLS and SSL, enabling the establishment of encrypted connections, sending HTTP/1.1 requests with custom headers, and upgrading to WebSocket protocols. Operates on socket and runtime types from Gluten and Httpun, supporting custom handlers for HTTP responses and protocol transitions. Provides low-level control over connection state and secure data exchange. Examples include sending authenticated API requests, handling streaming responses, and negotiating protocol upgrades.

Provides HTTP request and response parsing, serialization, and handling using Angstrom and Faraday. Works with byte sequences, strings, and custom protocol structures. Enables building high-performance web servers and clients with efficient memory usage.

Handles secure HTTP and network communication using TLS/SSL, supporting encrypted socket connections, HTTP/1.1 requests, and WebSocket upgrades. Operates on Unix socket addresses, SSL contexts, and runtime types, offering low-level control over connection states and secure data exchange. Provides functions to build HTTPS servers, manage session-specific configurations, and handle protocol transitions. Examples include enforcing client certificate authentication, sending custom HTTP headers, and negotiating secure WebSocket connections.
